sect1.title: Menubar
sect1.para: At the top of the GnomeSword main window is the menubar. Almost all of the functions are available by activating the appropriate menu item. The functions have been grouped according to their type. For example, the file operations have been grouped into the File menu.

sect1.title: Toolbars
sect1.para: The function of the Toolbar is to provide control over the Bible Pane. Activation of the Toolbar option is done by moving the mouse cursor over the desired toolbar button and selecting it. A tooltip will appear if the mouse cursor is held stationary over a toolbar button, describing the function of the button.
The Toolbar consists of the following functions:

listitem.para: History View Toggle
Bible Book Selector
Bible Chapter Selector
Bible Verse Selector
Bible Passage Summary

sect2.title: History Forward/Backward Selector
sect2.para: Switches between current and previous passage selections.

sect2.title: Bible Book Selector
sect2.para: Selects the Biblical book to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect2.title: Bible Chapter Selector
sect2.para: Selects the Biblical chapter of current book to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect2.title: Bible Verse Selector
sect2.para: Selects the Biblical verse of current chapter to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect2.title: Bible Passage Summary
sect2.para: Allows manual editing of passages which are displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take effect once Enter is typed.

warning.para: Ensure that edited book,chapter and verse naming is correct, otherwise the wrong or no information will be displayed.

sect1.title: The Sidebar
sect1.para: On the left hand side of GnomeSword there is the Side Pane. Here the user can switch between the different Sword modules, view bookmarks, do simple searches and view verse lists. To switch between all Side Pane functions, shortcuts have been placed at the bottom of the Side Pane. Clicking on the shortcut activates the option.

sect1.title: The Bible Text Pane
sect1.para: Positioned to the right of the Shortcut bar is the Bible text pane. All your different translations will be displayed for full viewing. When starting GnomeSword either your default Bible translation or the translation last used will be displayed.

sect2.title: Opening A Specific Bible Translation
sect2.para: In order to change the current Bible translation to another of your choice:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text Pane. In the popup menu choose FileOpen Module and select your specific translation that you want to view.
under the Modules option in the Sidebar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice and select your specific translation.

sect2.title: Using the Parallel View Mode
sect2.para: A nice function in GnomeSword is the ability to view your specified bible text in parallel in five translations of your choice. The Parallel View mode can be accessed by selecting Parallel View just below the Bible Text Pane, next to the Standard View tab. Please note that you can only view one verse at a time. You can change the verse by selecting another verse, chapter, or book at the toolbar. Also note that modules that are Old Testament or New Testament only (eg Westminster Leningrad Codex and Byzantine Majority Text ) will not be able to display books, chapters, or verses that they don't have.

Additionally, a separate Parallel View window can be selected from the right click menu with Detach/Attach. Your Bible pane will return to its normal single text view, and the new Parallel View window will show the complete chapter, in all 5 translations.

sect2.title: Opening A Separate Bible Translation
sect2.para: In order to view a Bible translation separate from the GnomeSword interface:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane. In the popup menu choose FileOpen current in a dialog Module .
Under the Modules option in the Sidebar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice . Then right-click on your specific translation and choose the Open in dialog option.

sect2.title: Finding Out About The Current Translation
sect2.para: To find out about the Bible translation currently being displayed:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane. In the popup menu choose About module name.

sect2.title: Module Options
sect2.para: Most Bible translations have additional options which the user can select.

listitem.para: Words Of Christ In Red
Strong's Numbers
Morphological Tags
Footnotes
Scripture Cross-Reference
Headings

note.para: Translations in other languages such as Greek or Hebrew have specific options which deal only with the specific language.

sect2.para: In order to access these options:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane. In the popup menu (example shown), choose Module Options and select the specific option.

sect2.title: View Options
sect2.para: There are several additional modes that can be selected from the menubar's View pulldown.

listitem.para: Verse Style - Toggles between Bible text display in separate verses, or in paragraphs instead. This is set on a per-module basis.

Pin Tabs - When more than one tab is open, each one's verse is navigated separately in the disabled case. If tab pinning is enabled, then all tabs navigate together, keeping all translations on the same verse.

Read Aloud - If you enable this, then GnomeSword will funnel all selected verses through the festival text-to-speech system. Festival is a widely-available TTS, often installed by default in Linux distributions.

sect2.title: Specific Word Meanings
sect2.para: In order to check the meaning of a specific word, click on the desired word you wish to lookup. The word should then highlight itself and the explanation should be displayed, if available, in the Dictionary Pane.

sect2.title: Finding A Specific Word
sect2.para: To find a specific word within a passage:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text Pane. In the popup menu, choose Edit-> Find. A separate dialog will appear, which will allow single or multi word searches. Fill out dialog and click the Find button.

sect1.title: Viewer Pane
sect1.para: The Viewer Pane is where the user sees Strong's numbers, morphological tags, footnotes, and cross-references that the Bible Text Pane provides.

Footnote content is normally transient in the Viewer Pane: It is displayed while your mouse hovers over the footnote indicator *n in the Bible text, and then disappears when your mouse moves off. But some translations' footnotes (e.g. NET Bible's) can be very large, so that not all the text is visible. To anchor the text so that you can scroll it in the Viewer Pane, middle-click the indicator and move to the Viewer Pane.

Cross-reference indicators *x also display transiently in the Viewer Pane. Left-clicking the indicator will send the set of references to the Verse List in the Sidebar, where you can click them individually for reading in the Viewer Pane.

sect1.title: The Commentary Pane
sect1.para: The Commentary pane is where the commentary modules are displayed. This provides easy reading, reference and access to different commentaries currently installed. The passage viewed by the Commentary pane is directly controlled by the current passage viewed in the Bible Text pane, so in order to change to a different passage commentary, select the desired passage on the Toolbar.

note.para: By changing to passage settings on the Toolbar, the contents in the Bible Text pane and the Commentary Pane will be changed.

sect2.title: Finding Out About The Commentary Module
sect2.para: To find out about the commentary currently being displayed:

listitem.para: right-click in the Commentary Pane. In the popup menu choose About module name.
